content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

Sure, here's an example of how you might implement the `q_and_a_extractor` function in Julia:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::Markdown.MD)
    questions = String[]
    answers = String[]

    in_question = false
    in_answer = false

    for line in eachline(IOBuffer(md.content))
        if in_question && startswith(line, '#') &&!startswith(lstrip(line), '# Answer')
            in_question = false
        end

        if in_answer && startswith(line, '#') &&!startswith(lstrip(line), '# Question')
            in_answer = false
        end

        if startswith(line, '# Question')
            in_question = true
            push!(questions, "")
            continue
        end

        if startswith(line, '# Answer')
            in_answer = true
            push!(answers, "")
            continue
        end

        if in_question &&!isempty(questions)
            questions[end] *=
